busdesc: As of November 3, 2009, Schering-Plough Corporation was acquired by Merck & Co. Inc. Schering-Plough Corporation discovers, develops, manufactures, and sells pharmaceuticals worldwide. It operates in three segments: Prescription Pharmaceuticals, Animal Health, and Consumer Health Care.
Merck & Co., Inc. provides healthcare solutions worldwide.
Pfizer Inc. develops, manufactures, and sells healthcare products worldwide.
Johnson & Johnson researches and develops, manufactures, and sells various products in the health care field worldwide. It operates in three segments: Consumer, Pharmaceutical, and Medical Devices.
Wyeth LLC manufactures pharmaceuticals and healthcare products. The company offers pharmaceutical and biotechnology products, consumer health care products, and animal health care products.

Bristol-Myers Squibb Company discovers, develops, licenses, manufactures, and markets biopharmaceutical products worldwide. It offers products in hematology, oncology, cardiovascular, and immunology therapeutic classes.

Eli Lilly and Company discovers, develops, manufactures, and markets pharmaceutical products worldwide. It offers endocrinology products for diabetes; osteoporosis in postmenopausal women and men; and human growth hormone deficiency and paediatric growth conditions.

Baxter International Inc., through its subsidiaries, develops and provides a portfolio of healthcare products. The company operates through North and South America; Europe, Middle East and Africa; and Asia-Pacific segments.
Forest Laboratories, LLC develops, manufactures, and sells branded forms of ethical drug products in the United States and Europe.
CVS Health Corporation provides health services and plans in the United States.
AmerisourceBergen Corporation sources and distributes pharmaceutical products in the United States and internationally.
